intro: Episcia andina, commonly known as the Andean waxplant, is a tropical plant native to the Andes Mountains. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating, giving it its common name. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Episcia andina is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
